assistants.name: Action / Pose Extractor
assistants.description: Detects actions and extracts poses/keypoints from images to create annotations or drive previews. Helpful for E2/G3 planning and animation blocking.
steps: Provide input via upload or paste text.
Add a short prompt describing the goal.
Run the assistant to generate output.
Review, then attach the file to a UA deliverable.

assistants.name: Blockout Builder
assistants.description: Converts images into voxel/brick blockouts for rapid level or toy prototyping. Useful for evaluating silhouette, scale, and composition without detail.
steps: Provide input via upload or paste text.
Add a short prompt describing the goal.
Run the assistant to generate output.
Review, then attach the file to a UA deliverable.

assistants.name: Image → 3D OBJ
assistants.description: Lifts a single reference image into a lightweight 3D OBJ/GLB with basic geometry and texture. Ideal for prop previews and quick block-ins tied to E/G phases.
steps: Upload a reference image or drop it into the box.
Optionally enter style or geometry hints in the prompt.
Click Run to process; preview appears below.
Download the OBJ/GLB and manifest for the UA deliverable.

assistants.name: Schematic / Blueprint Maker
assistants.description: Transforms references into clean, labeled blueprint/line-art sheets with callouts. Great for manufacturing handoff, rig notes, and scene tech packets.
steps: Provide input via upload or paste text.
Add a short prompt describing the goal.
Run the assistant to generate output.
Review, then attach the file to a UA deliverable.

assistants.name: Toy & Packaging Composer
assistants.description: Generates toy mockups and retail-ready box comps from concept art; can output dielines and hero renders. Perfect for P-phase deliverables.
steps: Provide input via upload or paste text.
Add a short prompt describing the goal.
Run the assistant to generate output.
Review, then attach the file to a UA deliverable.

assistants.name: Text → Image Generator
assistants.description: Creates high-quality concept art directly from prompts (optionally with style tokens or references). Great for fast visual exploration before locking designs.
steps: Upload a reference image or drop it into the box.
Optionally enter style or geometry hints in the prompt.
Click Run to process; preview appears below.
Download the OBJ/GLB and manifest for the UA deliverable.
